fields.description:
h5. Description:
TIMOB-18214 was reported and contains two distinct issues. This ticket is being created to track one of those items.

A complex app running on arm64 devices (may also occur on arm7 but we have not witnessed this to date)

h5. Steps to reproduce:
1) Use code sample available internally
2) Install on iPhone 6+, 6 or iPhone 5s
3) Use application features until crash occurs

h5. Result:
Crash

h5. Expected Result:
No crash

h5. Notes
This does not occur with iOS 7.0.3, 7.1.1, or 7.1.2
*THIS IS A REGRESSION* DOES NOT OCCUR in SDK 3.4.1.GA
fields.summary: 64bit iOS devices: Intermittent crashes with SDK 3.5.0
fields.environment:
Mac OS 10.10.1
Xcode 6.1.1 GM
CLI: 3.4.1 GA
Alloy: 1.5.1 GA
Titanium SDK version 3.5.0.v20141212180914
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.4.1.201410281743

comments.body:
This issue is *NOT* present in the following TiSDKs:
* 3.1.3.GA
* 3.2.1.GA
* 3.3.0.GA
* 3.4.0.GA
* 3.4.1.GA

It is only present in the following TiSDKs:
* 3.5.0.Alpha
* 3.5.0.Beta
* 3.5.0.RC

I am going to reformat the text of this ticket to reflect the crashing behavior. Things are getting a little confused by the data I provided in the original report conflicting with the comments and edits. For example, the logging behavior is not a regression, but it seems the crash is. I will create a new ticket for the logging issue as I have no iron-clad indication the two are related (log output and crash). I will try to provide the most accurate detail on the affected iOS and device information.

Pull pending for tijscore
https://github.com/appcelerator/tijscore/pull/26

Titanium SDK PR's
https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/6560
https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/6561
We are confident that the root cause of this issue has been addressed with SDK 3.5.0.v20150112015717.
